Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: We priced the tokens at 0.08 ETH (not including bonuses) to give early advertisers a large incentive to use/burn their tokens for the discounts (since face value is 0.5 ETH). This helps us build the network more quickly, making the product better for everyone. Logically, if the network is successful, then the tokens should be bought by advertisers at around face value.  The face value of the token/coupon is arbitrary, and is related to the token supply.  Because the face value of the coupon is denominated in Ether, the tokens are worth more to advertisers if the price of Ether goes up.  Thanks for asking a good question.

Author: m3ta
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: The platform seems great, but I am a visual learner. Is there any way we could see images of what the platform interface may look like?  I love the idea but I would really enjoy seeing a concept of the software in action so I can understand how your vision will be put onto the screen.

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Hey m3ta, thanks for the comment. The best place to go is the DApp itself --> www.app.foreground.io  You'll see there is a quick tutorial video on how to generate your own affiliate link to earn commissions for the Foreground token sale, as well.  We know its not super sexy (yet) but the functionality is there and you'll receive credit for any sales your link generated (just like in traditional affiliate marketing). Let us know if you run into any issues with the product.  Lastly, I would encourage you to join our slack channel and become part of our young community.  Best,  Scott

Author: Oleander
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: I tried this, and got an affiliate link with FPID=1 (the demo video had FPID=2).  Somehow I don't think I got a unique link tied to my Ethereum address.

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Hi Oleander,  The link you received is definitely unique to your Ethereum address (the one that you used to send the 0 ether transaction). The FPID is an indicator of which promotion the link is tied to. If you look closely, I'm using the ropsten test network for the video, so there is no realtionship between the IDs in the video and the IDs that you'll receive using the mainnet application.

Author: Oleander
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Here is the affiliate link your system gave me:  https://foreground.io?FDPAID=1&FPID=1  Can you see why I might question whether it's unique and tied to my ethereum address?  Perhaps you could explain how this works.  If you can tell me the ethereum address this link is tied to, that would convince me.

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Hi Oleander,  The referrer address for that link is 0x54daebc3ec3a693f876f90f52d11d3fd65c47498  There were a handful created after you, but you were one of the first, hence the low ID.

Author: Oleander
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: OK, thanks so much!  I'm convinced.  I want to confirm to anyone following this, that the referrer address is indeed correct.  Good luck with the ICO.  You have a working product, and you're solving a real problem.  I like the bootstrapping aspect of it... activating the product to assist in the ICO itself.

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Thanks for the kind words, Oleander. We're definitely a lot more bootstrappy than most of the other ICOs. We really hope that sets us apart

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Hey @KrLos. Those are great questions.  1. As mentioned in our whitepaper, our platform does have a small fee associated with it that will pay for Foreground's operation and make sure we're running a sustainable business. Here's the link: https://foreground.io/whitepapers/foreground-whitepaper.pdf  2. Given that our bounty is only 2% of the token issuance, it should not have any dramatic effect on trading even if, for some reason, all bounty players should decide to liquidate at the same time. Our bounty is relatively low compared to most other projects, so this risk is actually lower for us than for most other token holders of different projects.

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Our initial customers are anyone who sells goods (ICO tokens, crypto exchanges, hardware wallet retailers, etc...) for cryptocurrency. We allow these sellers to integrate our product directly into the smart contracts that receive their payments, providing them with an instant affiliate program. There are already 3 billion dollars worth of crypto transactions occurring (even excluding exchange transactions), and these sellers/merchants don't even have access to the most basic affiliate tools.  Our product is also broadly applicable to the general affiliate industry ($7 billion market). We can reduce costs in this space by establishing an efficient market for affiliate services using the blockchain as a common protocol that connects advertisers and publishers.

Author: crypt0e
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: What type of analytics are available to track the affiliate's link turnover success?

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: For some more information about the tech agency running the incubator that helped create Foreground:  http://www.prweb.com/releases/2017/08/prweb14623256.htm

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Crypt0e, Foreground plugs directly into the smart contracts that facilitate the advertiser's transactions. This allows us to log every transaction that occurs and provide affiliate's with a 100% accurate record of their conversions (this works beautifully for ICOs). This is dramatically different than the status quo, where the affiliate network usually has little-to-no integration with payment services the advertiser is using.

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: There are a lot of things we can do from an analytics standpoint. The Beta will provide more basic functionalities. As our userbase grows, we'll leverage the feedback from our community to build more elaborate and needed tools as requested to improve Foreground consistently as we move forward.

Author: Cryptosaint$
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Thanks for the follow-up @ Cryptosaint$. We will be launching the product by having our ICO be the first ever affiliate campaign on our own platform to show future users and customers that we are confident in our solution and to get a feel for the implementation. That way, we can immediately work on improvements.  With that said, we are on schedule to release the platform and have affiliates sign up starting on November 28th (the start date of our ICO).

Very specifically, our office is here:  https://www.google.com/maps/place/11+E+Illinois+St,+Chicago,+IL+60611/@41.8906454,-87.6362069,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x880e2cade0c3760f:0x5487f3105e140498!8m2!3d41.890722!4d-87.627451  We love visitors, so if anyone is in the Chicago area and wants to drop by the office, please PM me.

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Assuming you're asking what blockchain we use for our token? If that's the case, our token is ERC20-based (Ethereum).

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Yes, both the token (ERC-20) and the platform are on Ethereum. This makes sense for us because ICOs are natural customers for us, and most ICOs are issuing ERC-20 tokens.

Body: I've already seen some similar ICO, why are you different?

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: @predatorquintic we've noticed that there are some other startups that want to build a solution for the space. Can you name the ones you've seen?  The 2 core things that differentiate us from the competitors we are aware of:  1. Unlike most ICOs in general, we have a product finished and we're in talks with our first customers, so there's a good chance we'll see our first revenues before the end of the year. Based on what we've seen that puts us 6-8 months (at least) ahead of any direct competitor in the production phase.  2. Our technical team is made up of full-time senior developers at a well-respected tech agency (you can read more here --> https://www.productiveedge.com/)

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Scott mentions two great points about our team and our product. I'd also like to add that our token is structured as a coupon and its value rises when the price of Ether rises. The specifics of our token are very attractive to our token holders. You can find specifics about this here:  https://www.foreground.io/whitepapers/foreground-token-sale-summary.pdf

Author: crypt0e
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Will the payment, via the affiliate programs, settle at the end of the day or is payment realized instantly? How do I establish credibility? Also, how do you 'find' advertisers or publishers that are the correct fit? Thanks again for the previous quick response.

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: 1. The settlement period can contractually be set by the advertiser. It can be instantaneous or delayed (like it normally is in traditional affiliate marketing) depending on the campaign specifics the advertiser selects. 2 & 3. In a nutshell, your payment or conversion data build your profile and reputation within the Foreground ecosystem. Thus, advertisers and publishers will be able to analyze one another using various data points and metadata to find their best fit.

Author: ShroomsKit_Disgrace
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: OUR PRODUCT  Foreground allows advertisers to create promotions, define payment terms, and seamlessly track their ad spend, all directly on the blockchain. Foreground is more than just a market for user attention or a registry of publishers — it's a complete cost-per-sale (CPS) network without the middle man. Unlike most ICOs, we have a product ready now.      DEAL TOKEN ON SALE: NOVEMBER 28th    The Foreground DEAL Token provides advertisers with discounts on the Foreground platform. Here are some of the highlights:  1 DEAL token = 80% off Foreground Fees up to 0.5 ETH 675,675 maximum total supply 74% (500,000) offered to the public Coupon is tied to the price of Ether Advertisers save money by using DEAL tokens      LINKS  Watch our video Visit our website Read our whitepaper Read our token summary Check out our blog Follow us on twitter Chat with us on slack (sign up to newsletter for invite) Use our press kit See our incubator partner

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: The broader crypto/blockchain infrastructure needs to mature more in order to really undermine the current affiliate networks and penetrate the traditional markets, which is why we built a product for the ICO space first. That way we can sign up customers/users immediately and help mature the ICO marketing landscape

Author: szfinx
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: How is your token holders/investors make profit of participating in your ICO?

Author: Shankar94
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: That is a very interesting idea! Love it. If there is one thing publishers are bad at, it is being transparent. Sure there are power-houses like Google Adwords that are transparent to a high degree, but the smaller ad networks are sadly not always as transparent - this cuts right through that so that publishers and advertisers can trust eachother. Well done!  When do you estimate having a working prototype ready by?

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Appreciate it! We completed a prototype in May of this year and will publish our Beta in the coming weeks. We're already taking emails for signups for both ICOs and Affiliates who want to use our platform once we launch. You can find the email signup on our website

Author: rfeiner
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Hi szfinx,  The Foreground DEAL token functions like a coupon that is sold at a big discount. This is great for investors for the following reasons:  1. The coupon’s value will rise with the price of Ether because the coupon is denominated in Ether. 2. Most importantly, holders of the token know EXACTLY how much our token is worth if the underlying business succeeds (it’s the face value of the coupon).  You can find more details about the token here:  https://www.foreground.io/whitepapers/foreground-token-sale-summary.pdf

Author: scott1
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Foreground -- Affiliate Marketing and Advertising On the Blockchain
Body: Check out our whitepaper (page 18 and 19), where we break down the token structure: https://foreground.io/whitepapers/foreground-whitepaper.pdf
